intro: Pichonia novocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia pichonia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, forested areas and is often found in the understory of humid tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
